title: Another PR hit for fonts...
content:
“X-Rated Font Used on Third-Grade Handout”

[http://www.telegram.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20060918/APA/609182146](http://web.archive.org/web/20070114014455/http:/www.telegram.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20060918/APA/609182146)

“MONROE, N.Y.— School officials apologized after an X-rated font was used on a third-grade spelling packet handed out to parents. The font showed male and female stick figures in provocative poses to form the letters of the alphabet.”
author: sii

comments.content:
\> Administrators said the teacher did not use the font intentionally

And this is why we should license users, not fonts. If you aren’t smart enough not to use a sex font on a school newsletter, you are forced to use comic sans.
Hey, that’s my alma mater! I still live in the area and I’m suprised I haven’t heard about this already.
